videos.title: Musicademy Worship Guitar - the original Beginner box set
videos.description:
Would you like to learn to play guitar in worship or improve the skills you already have? A whole years' worth of worship guitar teaching on three DVDs plus advice and guest lessons from some of the best known worship leaders in the world. 

Suitable for both acoustic and electric guitar. Available from http://www.musicademy.com/info/worship-guitar/ This original DVD set is now half price. You'll also find our new 4-DVD Beginning Worship Guitar Course on the website. Both courses are also available in our online subscription site.

A highly practical step by step guitar teaching course from Musicademy's Andy Chamberlain. Three Beginners and three Intermediate DVDs. Each DVD is 2 hours long and includes daily practice backing tracks and drum grooves to turn your new found knowledge into ingrained skills. All taught with contemporary worship songs that you can use straight away to enhance your worship, and those you worship with.

Plus learn to play Delirious songs with Stu G, hear what Matt Redman, Chris Tomlin, David Crowder, Tim Hughes, Lex Buckley and others have to say about worship leading. Exclusive video clips and teaching from Tre Sheppard from Onehundredhours.

Each DVD follows a structured programme refined from the courses that we have already successfully taught to hundreds of students.

For instant access to ALL Musicademy's 1,200 worship training videos head over to our online video streaming subscription site https://www.musicademy.com/training

videos.title: Song Learner Series - Worship Guitar
videos.description:
Three DVDs for acoustic guitarists called the "Song Learner Series". They are available (now at HALF PRICE) from http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/christian-guitar/existing-player/intermediate/christian-guitar-lessons.html. Also available in our online subscription site.

Each of the 2-hour DVDs contain six or seven 12-20 minute lessons teaching you to play a contemporary worship song. Each lesson will soon also be available as an individual paid for download.
Songs featured include Everlasting God, Beautiful One, The Father's Song and Facedown as well as a number of challenging hymns - In Christ Alone and David Crowder's beautiful arrangement of All Creatures of Our God and King.
  
The idea of the Song Learner Series is to enable you to master the guitar parts played on the original record, note for note, and as such significantly enhance your playing. In each lesson you will learn how to:
Master the right strumming pattern for the song
Find easy ways to play complex chords
Get the right rhythm and pacing
Learn the one finger "cheat" chords that the professionals use to make your playing sound smooth
Develop great finger picking
Plus hints, tops and techniques you can use in other songs
 
The Song Learner DVDs are presented by Andy Chamberlain who will be familiar to you from the Musicademy Worship Guitar Course DVDs.. Andy's accessible teaching approach breaks each section of the song into bite-sized chunks, helps you play it through a few times and then bolts it together with the rest of the song, step-by-step so that you get each sequence into muscle memory. The Song Learner Series is designed to help you play more songs using the technical principles taught on the Musicademy Worship Guitar Course DVDs.

Please visit us at http://www.musicademy.com

For instant access to ALL Musicademy's 1,200 worship training videos head over to our online video streaming subscription site https://www.musicademy.com/training

Loads of FREE worship resources on our website including chord charts, strumming patterns and articles on music and worship. 

Go to the Members Download section to register

videos.title: Musicademy - Keyboards Course (Beginner and Intermediate)
videos.description:
Transform your keyboard playing with this step-by-step teaching programme on this DVD course. Buy them from http://www.musicademy.com/info/worship-keyboard/

Also available in our online subscription site.

For instant access to ALL Musicademy's 1,200 worship training videos head over to our online video streaming subscription site https://www.musicademy.com/training

The Beginners Series volumes 1-4
Teaching keyboards for worship with a proven step-by-step method without having to wade through traditional piano lessons

    * Learn to play well known worship songs and hymns in different keys
    * Use major, minor and slash chords as the basis for contemporary playing
    * Follow contemporary chord charts rather than traditional music scores
    * Play scales, arpeggios and chords and understand how to use them in modern worship songs
    * Understand and use voicings for smooth sounding chord changes
    * Develop right and left hand rhythm skills and introduce variety using broken chords, auxiliary and passing notes

2 hours of teaching on each of 4 DVDs including interviews and advice from worship leaders Stuart Townend, Brenton Brown, Vicky Beeching, Tim Neufeld (Starfield), Tommy Walker, Noel Richards, Leeland Moring and Andy Piercy (producer for Delirious? and Graham Kendrick).

Featuring daily practise backing tracks and play throughs with the Musicademy band. 

The Intermediate Series volumes 1-3

Either for people who learnt to play classical piano as a child but now want to play contemporary worship music with ease. Also ideal for people who already play worship keyboards but want to extend their techniques and move out of their comfort zone. The Intermediate Course will enable students to:

    * Approach the keyboard as a chords based instrument and lose your dependency on the music score
    * Integrate added, suspended and extended chords into your playing
    * Use inversions and alternative voicings for smoother playing
    * Develop left and right hand rhythm skills to fit the groove of the song
    * Improvise using melodic fills, auxiliary and passing notes
    * Use string, pads, electric piano and organ sounds
    * Develop techniques for leading worship as a keyboard player
    * Choose the right equipment for you
    * Understand the tools that help you play by ear

2 hours of teaching on each of 3 DVDs including interviews and advice from worship leaders Stuart Townend, Brenton Brown, Vicky Beeching, Tim Neufeld (Starfield), Tommy Walker, Noel Richards, Leeland Moring and Andy Piercy (producer for Delirious? and Graham Kendrick).

videos.title: Musicademy Intermediate Acoustic Worship Guitar Trailer
videos.description:
This is the sampler to Musicademy's  Intermediate Acoustic Worship Guitar DVDs. You can buy them at www.musicademy.com but this will give you a really good idea of what's on the DVDs. The course is also available in our online subscription site.

For instant access to ALL Musicademy's 1,200 worship training videos head over to our online video streaming subscription site https://www.musicademy.com/training

The 3-disk DVD series is perfect for acoustic worship guitarists who want to take their playing to the next level. A years worth of lessons, tricks and techniques. 7 hours of instruction on 3 DVDs plus animated graphics, close up shots tips from worship leaders. You will learn:

    * Over 60 new substitute chord shapes in keys G,C,D,A,E and B
    * How to build strumming patterns around the groove + 35 usable patterns
    * 18 finger style and 30 strumming technique ideas
    * 10 licks in the style of James Taylor, John Mayer and John Martyn
    * 12 unique exercises to help you master Travis picking  great for hymns!
    * Tricks for playing any open chord in B without barre chords or capo!
    * Use 10ths & 6ths to play alternative acoustic chord voicings up the neck
    * Use 5 and add9 chords for power and beauty
    * Find four different capo positions for all 12 keys
    * Play barre chords without the pain!
    * Understand Nashville numbering to transpose easily into any key

Plus

    * Daily practice backing tracks
    * How to use high strung and baritone guitars in worship
    * Acoustic guitar buyers guide

videos.description:

We've had some questions about this lesson so here is an explanation of what is being played.

Even if you can’t see Matt's right hand, when he moves across fret 1 for instance its clearly audible when it’s a Bb an Eb or an Ab. 

The run up some people have asked about is when it mimics the melody on ‘what heights of love’. This is explained around 3 mins 40. and takes the notes of the melody.  - Eb G and Bb (an arpeggio over that Eb/G chord)  and then to an Ab for that Ab chord. 

Everything Matt plays here are chord tones so if you’re having difficulty we’d suggest getting hold of a chord chart for the song in that original key of Eb. The bass notes you’ll be fretting will be one of the three chord tones in the chord being played.  If you haven’t worked through chord tones yet we’d suggest either the Intermediate Worship Bass Course or the Play by Ear and Understand Chords Course, both of which will give you a clearer understanding of the chord tone choices you can play. This will help you narrow down your note choices to one of three in the chord.

videos.title: Controlling ProPresenter
Intermediate Acoustic Worship Guitar Course - Free lesson on 5 chords, add9 chords and more
videos.description:
This lesson includes:

- Using 5 chords 
- Using add9 chords 
- Playing in B without a capo
- Playing in B with a detuned E
- Tim Hughes on using the spoken word in worship 
- Tre Sheppard from Onehundredhours on advice for worship leaders
- David Ruis on whether or not it is important to be a great vocalist
- Noel Richards on eyes open or closed during worship

Moving on a stage further with chords this section digs into some more unusual chords to add style and delicacy to your chord vocabulary. So we explore shapes for '5' chords and add9 chords for adding strength or beauty to the sounds, we look at playing open chords in B without using barre chords or a capo! And even look at playing in B with a detuned top E for all sorts of new sounds! There's a section on using a high strung guitar in worship and more worship leading tips from Tim Hughes, David Ruis, Tre Shepherd and Noel Richards.

You can buy the rest of the 3-DVD set here: http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/christian-guitar/existing-player/acoustic-worship-guitar.html

For instant access to ALL Musicademy's 1,200 worship training videos head over to our online video streaming subscription site https://www.musicademy.com/training

videos.description:
This lesson, taken from Musicademy's Intermediate Acoustic Worship Course DVDs starts to get into the real meat of the course as we take the chords further and look at cheats and substitutes in the key of C. As with other lessons we take it deeper with some licks and tricks that work well with 'C' shapes and finally have some great tips on song selection and set lists from Tim Hughes, Vicky Beeching and Noel Richards. If you've been the kind of worship leader or player that has always stuck mainly to some 'G' based shapes this lesson will massively expand your chord library.

A free handout showing the substitute chord shapes is here http://www.musicademy.com/2009/03/substitute-chords-for-the-key-of-c/

videos.description:
This is part 1 of a 3 part series designed to help you transfer your classical piano skills to contemporary chords-based worship keyboard playing. The other parts are available on the Intermediate Worship Keyboards Course DVDs or in our online subscription site. 

Worship Keyboards 1 - An introduction to playing using chords
Worship Keyboards 2 - Using chords to play How Great is Our God
Worship Keyboards 3 - Play through How Great is Our God with the Musicademy Band

 
In this part 1, you will be introduced to the concept of chords based playing and be given lots of exercises to practice. In part 2 (contained on the Musicademy Intermediate Worship Keyboards Course) you will apply that knowledge by playing the song How Great is Our God and in part 3 you can enjoy a play through of the song with the Musicademy band.

You can find out more here http://www.musicademy.com/info/worship-keyboard/

For instant access to ALL Musicademy's 1,200 worship training videos head over to our online video streaming subscription site https://www.musicademy.com/training

videos.title: Using Chords to play How Great is Our God on worship keyboards
videos.description:
Part 1 of this lesson (available on YouTube) teaches you the basics of how to play keyboards using chords. In this part 2, you will be guided to play the song How Great is Our God in a step by step manner with the tutor explaining all the different chords and voicings available. Unless you are already familiar with chords based playing we would recommend that you first watch part 1.

In part 3 (available along with many other lessons, from http://www.musicademy.com/info/worship-keyboard/) you can enjoy a play through of the song with the Muscademy band.

Once you have been through these lessons more proficient players can progress to the rest of the Intermediate course. If you are less experienced and would like to consolidate your new learning with relatively simple songs go to the Beginners course (volumes 3 and 4 would be ideal) or our online video Keyboard Song Learner lessons.You can download a chord chart in the free members section of our website and if you would like a further detailed explanation of chords based playing, you will also find some written articles there.

videos.title: Worship Backing Band for Churches and Small Groups DVD Volume 2
videos.description:
Does your church want to have great times of worship together but you don't have any musicians? 

Worship Backing Band Volume 2 is a single DVD featuring backing tracks for 35 contemporary worship songs with on-screen lyrics and fully mixable vocals. This means that you can set the vocals at zero all the way up to full depending on whether you have a confident lead singer yourself.

All designed for churches and small groups on a budget.

For more information and to buy go to http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/backing-tracks/backing-track-dvds/worship-backing-band-for-churches-volume-2.html

New features for volume 2

Programmable play lists so you can choose the songs in advance and have them seamlessly flow from one to the next

As well as a TV/DVD, PC or Mac, you can rip the songs to an iPod, iPad, or smartphone

Create your own playlists
You can either select the songs individually and quickly via the simple DVD menu system or make a playlist where one song automatically follows the next via any standard media player like iTunes, Windows Media Player, Real Player etc.

Choose the level of vocals
You can mix the level of lead vocal from full to zero, or anywhere in between simply by adjusting the left/right audio balance on your your hifi, computer, mixing desk iPad or iPod. Full details of how to do this are given with the DVDs.

Songs featured 
The DVD features 35 of the best known worship songs from well loved older songs to modern hymns and new classics.

All are recorded in congregational (singable) keys and sung with meaning and emotion by some of the best session musicians involved in today's modern worship. 

The songs include:
A New Hallelujah
Above All
Amazing Grace (My Chains Are Gone) 
Ancient of Days
Breathe
Come Now is the Time
Dance
Days of Elijah
Desert Song
Hosanna (Praise is Rising)
How Can I Keep From Singing
How Deep The Father's Love For Us
How Great Thou Art
How He Loves
Immanuel
It's Your Love
Jesus Messiah
Love Come Down
My Soul Sings
No Reason to Hide
Open The Eyes Of My Heart
Our God (NOT Our God Saves Jon)
Psalm 62
Say So
So Great
The Stand
The Wonderful Cross
This is How We Know
We Fall Down
You Are My King (Amazing Love)
You Hold Me Now
You'll Come
You Are My All In All
Your Grace Is Enough
Your Name 

Looking for more songs?
Check out our Video Split Tracks - individually downloadable backing tracks with on-screen words.
http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/backing-tracks/split-track-vocals-christian-backing-tracks.html

videos.title: Free worship keyboard lesson - You Alone Can Rescue
videos.description:
Here's a complete lesson taken from Musicademy's Worship Keyboard Collection. Teaching Matt Redman and Jonas Myrin's You Alone Can Rescue, this lesson focuses on teaching riffs and interesting lines the keyboard player can use as well as making the most of different sounds on the keyboard itself.

This lesson gives a good introduction to the style of teaching on the Worship Keyboard Collection where you will learn the keyboard parts to 18 different songs. First you listen to a professional (Worship Backing Band) recording of the song and hear tutor Tim Martin discussing and unpacking the different sounds and techniques. An on screen chord chart also guides you through the song. Tim then teaches each of those parts using camera close-ups of the keyboard before inviting you to join him in a play through. These lessons will radically improve your playing of both these individual worship songs but also improve your overall musicianship.

Buy the DVD here http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/keyboards/beginner/worship-keyboard-collection.html
For instant access to ALL Musicademy's 1,200 worship training videos head over to our online video streaming subscription site https://www.musicademy.com/training

Watching this lesson is also a good opportunity for you to see our Worship Backing Band MultiTrack software in action. This isolates the different instruments enabling you to either solo them or remove them from the mix.


Chord charts

You can buy the Worship Keyboard Collection either on DVD or in our online subscription site. The 18 chord charts used in the series are available in a discounted bundle pack 
http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/chord-charts/keyboard-chord-charts.html

videos.title: Beginning Worship Guitar lesson - Cadd9 chord
videos.description:
Here's a free lesson from Musicademy's new Beginning Worship Guitar Course which is available both on DVD or in our online subscription site. This is quite an early lesson in the course and teaches the chord Cadd9.

This is quite an unusual approach to guitar teaching in that we teach a very different sequence of chords to the more traditional bedrock chords of Em, G, C, D, A, Am etc. Here's an article explaining the development of the approach. http://www.musicademy.com/2013/03/how-to-teach-beginners-guitar-a-new-approach/

You can buy the full 4-DVD course here http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/christian-guitar/beginner/beginning-worship-guitar.html

For instant access to ALL Musicademy's 1,200 worship training videos head over to our online video streaming subscription site https://www.musicademy.com/training
 

In the full Beginning Worship Guitar course:

By following this 19 part, 10 hour course you will learn:

35 essential acoustic guitar chords
15 essential strumming patterns
Power chords, slash chords & easy 'cheat' chords
Finger picking patterns - Play in 4/4, 3/4 and 6/8 time
Play in any key using a capo
Play any song in 3 capo positions
Understanding chord charts
Transpose complex keys into guitar-friendly keys
Tuning, pick and strumming technique
Damping strings, learn the notes on the neck
And learn 10 worship songs:

A New Hallelujah - Michael W Smith
Praise is Rising (Hosanna) - Paul Baloche, Brenton Brown
Our God - Matt Redman
Your Grace is Enough - Matt Mayer
Beautiful One - Tim Hughes
How He Loves - David Crowder
My Soul Sings -- Delirious?
Open Eyes of My Heart - Paul Baloche
Amazing Grace (My Chains Are Gone) - Chris Tomlin
Indescribable - Chris Tomlin, Laura Story
The program includes 10 hours of lessons, practice tracks and tests.

SET UP

ELIMINATING FEEDBACK

videos.title: Beginner Plus Acoustic Worship Guitar Course
videos.description:
Beginner Plus Acoustic is perfect for fairly new acoustic guitar players who have a few basic chords and strumming patterns under their belt and want to get to the next level.  

The course combines learning some great new skills through technique lessons, exercises and play alongs and then puts them into practice by learning how to play some well known worship songs, all unpacked step-by-step. 

What do I learn? 

Technique lessons 
• An invaluable set of ‘G shape’ based ‘cheat’ substitute chords with one finger chord changes that you can use for any song in any key, even a cheat for a B minor chord, all without having to play any barre chords! 
• How to work out strumming patterns by identifying the strong ‘accents’ in the song’s groove 
• Picking skills using a pick for playing individual notes riffs and arpeggios
• Combining basic chords with the cheat chords to create new songs with easy finger movement
• Strumming patterns in 3/4 and 6/8 time signatures 

Songs 
• Forever (We Sing Hallelujah) (Kari Jobe)
• Cornerstone (Hillsong) 
• One Thing Remains (Bethel) 
• Our God is Greater (Chris Tomlin, Matt Redman) 
• Stronger (Hillsong)

Included extras 
Everything you need to master the song and technique is included:
• A chord chart for each song
• Full length video play through for each song with guitar parts on screen
• Exercises and play alongs 

Download the Beginner Plus Acoustic course here: http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/christian-guitar/guitar-downloads/beginner-plus-acoustic/beginner-plus-acoustic.html

videos.title: Worship Team Workshops
videos.description:
Could your worship team spare just two hours for some invaluable practical training that will forever improve how you play together? 

Worship Team Workshops are a growing range of downloadable video-based training courses from Musicademy that your worship team can work through together in a single session in the space you’d normally rehearse; whether that’s at church, in a practice room or even at home.

The workshops unpack invaluable skills through a series of training videos to watch together alongside guided group discussions, practical exercises and plenty space to play together to try out the learning. 

Each workshop is designed around a two-hour session and split into parts so can be approached piecemeal if you have less time in a single sitting. Plus, there are participant worksheets, facilitator notes to help guide the group leader and even backing tracks and chord charts to try out the learning with.

Course materials include:
- Downloadable video-based training lessons
- Printable delegate notes for all participates
- Printable facilitator notes for group leaders
- Worship song backing tracks
- Chord charts

Download the workshops here http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/worship-band-skills/worship-team-workshop.html

There are currently three workshops available to buy. And a 20% discount is automatically applied at the checkout when all three are purchased at the same time.

The workshops are designed for novice and seasoned musicians alike with learning that applies to both contemporary and orchestral instruments. Each takes 2 hours but can also be worked through in three smaller parts - 60/30/30 mins - if your team has less time in a single sitting.

Workshop: Understanding Groove
- What is groove and why it’s important
- Rhythmic mistakes that worship teams typically make
- How to find a consistent groove within any song
- How to find your instrument’s individual role within the groove
- How to create rhythmic and textural balance in the overall sound

Workshop: Dynamics
- Developing and using range
- Creating space in music
- Understanding different types of dynamics
- Using dynamics and tips for playing dynamically
- Building tension and release

Workshop: Listening and Communication Skills
- Setting up your stage to develop listening and communication skills
- Understanding different types of musical communication
- Developing musical communication skills with and without instrument
- Communication in rehearsals: tips and ideas
- Buy Listening and Communication Skills now


Download the workshops here http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/worship-band-skills/worship-team-workshop.html

Videos
The training videos are taken from Musicademy’s critically acclaimed Worship Band Skills course but distilled into bite-sized lessons focused on developing a single skill.

Discussions
Its really important for your team to have space to collectively reflect on how the learning might apply to them, so between the videos we guide you through some pertinent questions to help encourage honest but productive discussion.

Exercises
Once we’ve explored the learning in the videos and discussions we build in some fun and enlightening practical group exercises to help everyone develop the skills as a team.

Space to play together
Then after the exercises we leave plenty of time to play together to practice those skills in the context of well-known worship songs.

Worksheets, backing tracks and chord charts
We provide worksheets for each participant to help them understand the course schedule with space to make notes, and key ideas to remember. Some courses also feature worship song backing tracks and accompanying chord charts to use to work through the learning.

Facilitator notes
In addition to the participant worksheets we provide some written notes for the group leader/facilitator. These help them guide everyone through the course, keep the schedule on time, facilitate the discussions and exercises, encourage participation and be aware of potential ‘hotspot’ issues.


Download the workshops here http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/worship-band-skills/worship-team-workshop.html

videos.title: Practical Worship Leading Skills
videos.description:
Trailer for the new Musicademy Practical Worship Leading Skills Course.

A comprehensive 20 lesson course on practical worship leading presented by veteran worship leader and multi-instrumentalist Tim Martin with assistance from the rest of the Musicademy team.

The course covers an essential range of practical skills that every worship leader needs, but probably hasn’t been taught! 

Available as a permanent download herehttp://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/worship-band-skills/worship-leading/practical-worship-leading.html

Or subscribe and get access to the Worship Leading course and ALL Musicademy's other training in our subscription website here https://www.musicademy.com/worship-traininghttps://www.musicademy.com/worship-training/course/practical-worship-leading/

In the course first we unpack working with songs. Choosing songs, pitching songs in singable keys, teaching new songs and building a balanced and manageable song repertoire for your church. We explore practical skills involved in leading those songs well, plus the skills to train your band to play those songs better. There is excellent content on team recruiting and team building and we include some invaluable music theory based skills to help you transpose those songs into playable keys and even alter the chords to reflect different moods and responses. 

We’ve not found a worship leader who wouldn’t want to write songs, but many don’t know how, so we unpack practical ways to help you get started. 

We recognise most worship leaders also sing so we’ve put together some vocal warm-ups, exercises for developing your and your team’s vocal range and even ideas on how to care for your voice. 

As worship is very much not just about singing so we’ve included thoughts on how to engage your congregation in non-musical expressions of worship. 

Finally there are some invaluable top worship leading tips born out of the collective years of experience of the Musicademy team.

The course can be worked through as an individual or together as worship team and at the end of each lesson there’s a practical exercise practical exercise to help build the learning into your team’s everyday skill set.


Course content: 

20 lessons, each with optional practical exercises covering the following topics.

- Songs 
How to choose the right song key for your congregation 
Developing a song repertoire
Introducing and teaching new songs 

- Song Leading Skills 
Beginning and ending songs well 
Achieving flow 
Playing and singing with meaning and emotion 
Introducing spontaneous worship 
Worship leading top tips

- Essential Team Leader Music Theory 
Transposing chord charts into more playable keys 
Re-harmonizing/Chord substitution  

- Vocal Care 
How to look after your voice
Vocal warm-ups
Developing your vocal range

- Beyond Singing 
Broader creative (non-musical) worship ideas

- Song Writing 
Practical ideas to help you begin writing songs 

- Band Skills 
Learn to play rhythmically and build groove 
Understand and use dynamics  
Musical communication skills 

- Team Building 
Recruiting and evaluating new team members 
Building an effective team
Creating worthwhile and efficient rehearsals


The Worship Leading course is presented by Tim Martin, well known at Musicademy as the presenter of our Keyboard, Orchestral Instrument and Band Skills courses.

A multi-instrumentalist, Tim has worked in various worship leading and music minister roles and is currently Worship Director at E&A Church in Bristol. He is a graduate of and has taught on the Theology, Music and Worship course at London School of Theology and has previously worked as a high school music teacher.

The course also features specialist input from Andy Chamberlain, Nicki Rogers and Marie Page.

Watch on your own or with the rest of your team – each session includes a discussion or practical exercise so that the whole worship team can work through the topics covered.


Available as a permanent download here http://www.musicademy.com/store/uk/worship-band-skills/worship-leading/practical-worship-leading.html

Or subscribe and get access to the Worship Leading course and ALL Musicademy's other training in our subscription website here  https://www.musicademy.com/worship-training/course/practical-worship-leading/

videos.title: Creating Electric Guitar Parts in Worship: Space and Dynamic
videos.description:
First part of a mini series by guitarist Matt Isaac on how to create an electric guitar part in worship.

Key points covered in this video:
- Contrast makes things interesting.
- Use to follow the structure of the song e.g quiet moments.
- Use to exaggerate a build, buy dropping out/down at the beginning.
- Use space in your own part to create phrases.
- Listen to what else is happening, and use space in your part, to enhance hooks and phrases in others.

Find a graphic of the chord sequence Matt mentions on this blog post along with an article he has written on the video series https://www.musicademy.com/2018/10/creating-guitar-parts-for-worship-space-and-dynamic-video/

Watch out for the rest of the series:
- Range and Density
- Rhythmic Division
- Effects and Timbre

videos.title: Creating Electric Guitar Parts in Worship: Range and Density
videos.description:
First part of a mini series by guitarist Matt Isaac on how to create an electric guitar part in worship.

Key points covered in this video:
- Potch variation can be found within shapes, via string choice, not just along the fretboard
- Listen to other parts, use range to avoid overcrowding, and to contrast other things that are happening
- Use changes in pitch to mirror the song structure, or lyrical content
- Raising and lowering pitch of a part can create builds and drops; space and air from high parts, body and weight from low

Watch out for the rest of the series:
- Pitch and Dynamic
- Rhythmic Division
- Effects and Timbre

videos.description:

Key points covered in this video:
- How rhythmically dense do you want the part to be? Sometimes one chord per bar is enough!
- Add or reduce the feeling of pace through how you subdivide
- Mirror or contrast the pace or content of the song, or of other instrumental parts
- Increasing rhythmic density to build sections
- Interesting contrasts eg. quicker rhythms over half time groove

videos.title: Beginning and Ending Songs Well: Lesson from Practical Worship Leading Skills Course
videos.description:
When we asked which lesson you would like a free sneak preview of this is the one you voted for over 19 others from our Practical Worship Leading Skills Course.

This lesson unpacks a range of ideas and tips that seasoned worship leaders use to begin and end songs well.

There is 3.5 hours of teaching on the full course which is available as a download. And for a limited period we are offering the course at HALF PRICE!

Head over to our website for more info and to buy before the prices go back up:
http://musicademy.com/store/worship-band-skills/worship-leading/practical-worship-leading.html

Full course detail below:

- Introduction 
A brief introduction outlining the aims, content and approaches you can take to get the most out of the course.

- Choosing Songs Part 1 
This lesson explores how to pick sets of songs that flow together well, based around an approach to worship using the themes of ‘gathering’, ‘word,’ ‘response’ and ‘sending out.’

- Choosing Songs Part 2 
This brilliant lesson shows you how to pick songs in the best key for the congregation based on understanding where the strong notes typically lie in male and female vocal ranges.

- Beginning And Ending Songs Well  
This lesson unpacks a range of ideas and tips that seasoned worship leaders use to begin and end songs well.

- Learning To Play Rhythmically 
Here we look at the musicianship skills behind getting each instrument in your band to fit together rhythmically and how they can find their space in a song’s overall groove.

- Evaluating Team Motivations 
Some practical ideas on building a recruitment and evaluation process that works for your church for both new and existing team members.

- Using Dynamics 
An invaluable lesson and practical exercise, showing you how to use the different types of dynamics to create 10 levels/variations of light and shade.

- Team Building 
This lesson shows you how to create a set of ‘commitment agreements’ that will help you build your team while taking into account members with varying levels of skill, experience and availability.

- Good Rehearsals 
Some practical ideas on creating worthwhile, achievable and efficient rehearsals even with limited time, space or noise restrictions.

- Worship Beyond Singing 
A discussion with some very helpful practical ideas for engaging your congregation in worship activities that aren’t just song or music focussed.

- Playing And Singing With Meaning And Emotion 
This lesson helps you and your team connect together the theme and lyrics of the songs being sung with the music being played.

- Communication 
A lesson unpacking different forms of musical communication that will help you give clear and understandable cues to both your worship band and the congregation.

- Achieving Flow 
Some practical thoughts and exercise helping you to create sense of flow from song to song, with songs in different themes, keys, tempos and genres.

- Transposing Songs Into More Singable Keys - This ‘how to’ music theory based lesson unpacks a step by step guide for transposing songs from one key to another to suit different singers and instruments.

- Looking After Your Voice Part 1 - Vocal Health and Warm Ups
From ‘Sirening’ techniques to help you smooth out the cracks in your voice to advice on protecting your vocal chords, this lesson is a must for every worship leader that sings.

- Looking After Your Voice Part 2 - Developing Your Vocal Range 
This lesson shows you some great exercises to help extend and strengthen your vocal range.

- Spontaneous Worship 
Some simple, practical and musical ideas to help your congregation become familiar and comfortable with spontaneous singing in worship.

- Re-Harmonizing/Chord Substitution 
Another music theory based lesson to equip you with the tools to change or re-harmonize the chords in songs to create different sounds, moods or responses.

- Introduction to Song Writing 
Here we explore some great practical tips to help you start to write songs, develop and hone your ideas and apply them by actually writing a part of a song as the lesson unfolds!

- Worship Leading Tips 
A discussion with lots of invaluable worship leading do’s/don’ts and tips borne out of many years of worship leading experience.


Every lesson includes an optional exercise designed to help apply the learning and can be worked though individually or together as a team.


BUY NOW AT HALF PRICE (limited time only)
http://musicademy.com/store/worship-band-skills/worship-leading/practical-worship-leading.html

videos.title: Musicademy worship training day: Cornerstone with harmonies
videos.description: Closing song from a worship training day in Maidstone. The congregation were encouraged to harmonise to the song.

videos.title: Listen to the new MultiTracks from Worship Backing Band
videos.description:
Audio samples from each of the latest Worship Backing Band MultiTracks.

You Say - Lauren Daigle, Jason Ingram, Paul Maybury
Our congregational version of the amazing Lauren Daigle song reminding us of our worth in the sight of God

Resurrecting (Elevation) - Chris Brown, Mack Brock, Steven Furtick, Wade Joye, Matthews Thabo Ntele
This arrangement has been adjusted from the original to enable a fabulous flow of worship perfect for your local church and has great dynamics as you go through the song.

Your Love Awakens Me - Phil Wickham, Chris Quilala
A great up-tempo track but in a more accessible key than the original version.

His Mercy is More - Matt Papa, Matt Boswell
A 6/8 hymn that is really accessible for local churches especially in this slightly lower key than the original. A great message of forgiveness

.Death Was Arrested - Heath Balltzglier, Brandon Coker, Adam Kersh, Paul Smith, Paul Taylor (Northpoint Church)
A fabulous 6/8 track fully encompassing the gospel message and transposed down to the more reachable key of G.

Do It Again - Chris Brown, Steven Furtick, Mack Brock, Matt Redman
From delicate verses through to a soaring bridge this track journey's through the faithfulness of God

He Has Time (Common Hymnal)
An arrangement of Common Hymnals most beautiful #metoo song speaking about the healing God brings to us. Definitely look into the story behind this song, it makes the song even more special.

Glorious Day - Jason Ingram, Kristian Stanfill, Jonathan Smith, Sean Curren
A great band track proclaiming his salvation over us done in a more congregation friendly key of Bb

Living Hope - Phil Wickham, Brian Johnson
This fantastic Phil Wickham song brings hymn structured verses with a fabulous Chorus response section

Who You Say I Am - Ben Fielding, Reuben Morgan (Hillsong)
An up-tempo 6/8 number with brilliantly focused Biblical lyrics.

Worthy of it All - Ryan Hall, David Brymer
Such a worshipful track and is arranged so that it retains the fluid nature of the song while keeping it concise enough for a local church setting.

So Will I (100 Billion X) Joel Houston, Benjamin Hastings, Michael Fatkin (Hillsong)
Such amazing words in this epic Hillsong track.

The songs are available as wav files for any DAW (and include a free Ableton session file) and also as Transition MultiTracks for the Worship Backing Band MultiTrack Player (Mac, PC and iPad.There are also Every Key chord charts available for each song.

To buy the MultiTracks and to find out more about the Worship Backing Band MultiTrack Player go to https://www.worshipbackingband.com/blog/12-new-worship-multitracks/

videos.title: Drum and gospel choir "performance" from a Musicademy worship training day in London.
videos.description:
The vocalists and drummers had spent the day in two separate sessions. As part of their workshops they both worked on the song He is Yaweh by Dean Salyn.

This recording is of the final result. The two groups had not come together before.

Not a dry eye in the house.

Drum choir led by Terl Bryant and Mark Jones. Gospel Choir led by Nicki Rogers.
